intro: Compsanthus, commonly known as the Chinese lantern plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in temperate regions of Asia. Compsanthus species are shrubs that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with simple, alternate leaves. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
